Combination therapy doesn't just work better.

homepage.faq1Question: What if I can't afford all these treatments?
homepage.faq1Answer: The basic protocol costs as little as ‚Ç¨30 per month, which consists of minoxidil and microneedling using a dermaroller (a cheaper device which needs regular replacement). Our most expensive protocol sets you back ‚Ç¨50 per month. These prices exclude one-time starting costs. We offer budget-conscious options in our quiz that still target multiple mechanisms. You don't need to do everything at once‚Äîwe'll help you prioritize based on what matters most for your situation.
homepage.faq2Question: How do I know this will work for ME specifically?
homepage.faq2Answer: That's what our personalized quiz is for. Your hair type, loss pattern, budget, and concerns are unique. The quiz creates a protocol tailored to your specific situation. Clinical studies show 82-95% of people see improvement with proper combination therapy‚Äîand those numbers are from dual therapy studies. The full protocols we recommend (targeting all four mechanisms simultaneously) could potentially have even higher success rates. We can't predict individual results until you try consistently for 6 months.
homepage.faq3Question: What if I'm too far gone? My hair loss is pretty advanced.
homepage.faq3Answer: The earlier you start, the better. Current research suggests that areas with no growth for 2-3+ years have lower response rates‚Äîbut here's what's interesting: communities like r/tressless (where people document their results with no financial incentive) show surprising regrowth even in areas science would consider "dead." The research might be incomplete here. Thinning areas almost always respond well. Completely bald areas are less predictable, but many people see results anyway. The guide helps you assess your specific situation.
homepage.faq4Question: Do I have to use these treatments forever?
homepage.faq4Answer: Yes. Hair loss is a chronic condition. If you stop treatment, you'll lose what you gained within 3-6 months and continue losing hair. Think of it like brushing your teeth‚Äîit's ongoing maintenance, not a cure. The good news: once you establish a routine, most people find it becomes second nature.

about.pageTitle: About Us - Evidence-Based Hair Loss Information | Revive Your Hair
about.metaDescription: Learn about Revive Your Hair's mission to provide evidence-based, clinically-proven hair loss treatment information backed by scientific research.
about.heroTitleEnd: about hair loss shouldn't be this hard.
about.heroSubtitle: ‚Äî Vincent Jeffrey Alexander Tomann, Independent Researcher
about.authorIntro: Hi, I'm Vincent Jeffrey Alexander Tomann.
about.authorIntroText: I'm not a doctor or dermatologist. I'm an independent researcher who spent hundreds of hours reading clinical studies on hair loss because I needed to understand what actually works.
about.authorBackground: What started as personal research turned into this site. My background isn't in medicine‚Äîit's in rigorous pursuit of truth. I approach health content the way an investigative journalist approaches a story: follow the evidence, cite your sources, and be honest about what we know and don't know.
about.credentialsText: I don't have medical credentials, and I won't pretend otherwise. What I do have is the ability to read clinical research, understand statistical methodology, and translate complex medical literature into plain English. Every claim on this site is backed by peer-reviewed research, and I link to the original studies so you can verify everything yourself.
about.authorRole: I don't diagnose conditions or prescribe treatments.
about.authorRoleText: That's your doctor's job. My role is to synthesize the research so you can have informed conversations with your healthcare provider about what might work for your situation.
about.problemIntro: Spend 20 minutes googling hair loss treatments and you'll find:
about.problemRedditDesc: "Finasteride ruined my life" next to "Finasteride saved my life" with zero context about the actual data.
about.problemYouTubeDesc: Supplements, laser caps, essential oils‚Äîall promising results with zero clinical backing.
about.problemMedical: Medical sites that sound like textbooks
about.problemMedicalDesc: "Androgenetic alopecia presents with progressive miniaturization..." Cool, but what do I actually
about.problemExistsText: There are decades of clinical studies on what works for hair loss. But it's buried in medical journals behind paywalls, written in technical language, and scattered across hundreds of papers.
about.problemConclusion: So people either pay thousands for treatments they don't understand, or they do nothing because they can't figure out what's real.
about.whatIDoPara1: I read the studies and convert them into something you can understand without a PhD. And I've read a ton of studies because hair loss is a topic that deserves to be thoroughly researched.
about.whatIDoPara2: You can read my process below.
about.process1Desc: PubMed, medical journals, clinical trials. If it's not published and peer-reviewed, I don't cite it.
about.process2Title: I look at sample sizes and methodology
about.process2Desc: A study with 12 people isn't the same as one with 1,200. I note the difference.
about.process3Title: I translate medical language into plain English
about.process3Desc: "Androgenetic alopecia" becomes "pattern hair loss." "Follicular miniaturization" becomes "your hair is shrinking."
about.process4Title: I explain the mechanisms, not just the treatments
about.process4DescEnd: something works helps you make better decisions about your situation.
about.process5Desc: Side effects happen. Not everything works for everyone. Some questions don't have good answers yet. I tell you.
about.notPara1Text: If you want medical advice, talk to a dermatologist. What I provide is research synthesis‚Äîtaking what the clinical literature says and making it accessible.
about.notPara2: I'm not here to sell you supplements or miracle formulas. The treatments that work have decades of research behind them. They're also mostly generic and available anywhere.
about.standardText: If I wouldn't recommend it to someone I care about, I don't put it on this site. That's it. That's the filter.
about.whyPara1: Hair loss is personal. It affects how you see yourself. And the industry knows that, which is why it's full of overpriced treatments and false hope.
about.whyPara2: So we built this. A place where you can figure out what actually works, understand why it works, and make informed decisions without wading through medical jargon or marketing speak.
about.whyPara3: That's what we do. Read the studies, explain the mechanisms, show you the data.
